expr
Class VarFactory

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--expr.VarFactory
public class VarFactory
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a factory for shared variables in the abstract syntax representation of programs in a "while" language. It implements the Singleton pattern.

Method Summary
static VarFactory getInstance()
          Intialize and return the unique instance of this class.
 Variable makeVar(java.lang.String name)
          Return a shared variable or literal with the given identifier.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

getInstance

public static VarFactory getInstance()
Intialize and return the unique instance of this class. This method should be called only once throughout an entire program execution.
Parameters:
filename - The name of the file to log messages to.
verbose - Verbosity level: the higher the value the more is logged.
realtime - If true logged messages are immediately printed on standard error.
Returns:
The unique instance of the varFactory object.

makeVar

public Variable makeVar(java.lang.String name)
Return a shared variable or literal with the given identifier. The variable is held by a table and shared through references.
